entry.value: // Define global variable for Plotly%%00010const Plotly = arguments[0];%%00010%%00010// Generate a div which will later be filled with the plotly graph%%00010const d3 = Plotly.d3;%%00010var graphDiv = d3.select('body').append('div')%%00010 .attr('id', 'knimePlotlyGraph');%%00010%%00010debugger;%%00010var data = [{%%00010 type: 'violin',%%00010%%00009// In this example our required colums are located in 0 and 1%%00010%%00009// change the index to match the provided table %%00010%%00009x: knimeDataTable.getColumn(0),%%00010%%00009y: knimeDataTable.getColumn(1),%%00010%%00009points: 'none',%%00010%%00009box: {%%00010%%00009%%00009visible: true%%00010%%00009},%%00010%%00009line: {%%00010%%00009%%00009color: 'green',%%00010%%00009},%%00010%%00009meanline: {%%00010%%00009%%00009visible: true%%00010%%00009},%%00010%%00009transforms: [{%%00010%%00009%%00009// Type of the transform. In this case it will group by the weekdays%%00010%%00009%%00009type: 'groupby',%%00010%%00009%%00009// Select the Column it should be grouped for%%00010%%00009%%00009groups: knimeDataTable.getColumn(0),%%00010%%00009%%00009// Define styles for the different lines%%00010%%00009%%00009styles: [%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009{target: 'Sun', value: {line: {color: 'blue'}}},%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009{target: 'Sat', value: {line: {color: 'orange'}}},%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009{target: 'Thur', value: {line: {color: 'green'}}},%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009{target: 'Fri', value: {line: {color: 'red'}}}%%00010%%00009%%00009]%%00010%%00009}]%%00010}]%%00010%%00010// Add a title and disable zero lines. More about the layout can be learned here:%%00010// https://plot.ly/javascript/figure-labels/%%00010var layout = {%%00010 title: "Multiple Traces Violin Plot",%%00010 yaxis: {%%00010 zeroline: false%%00010 }%%00010}%%00010%%00010// Build the plot into the div "knimePlotlyGraph", which we have%%00010// created earlier.%%00010Plotly.plot('knimePlotlyGraph', data, layout);%%00010
